snippet: President Obama has taken away Mitt Romney’s advantage as the candidate voters say is most likely to restore the economy, according to the latest poll by The New York Times and CBS News.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds that Pres Obama has taken away Mitt Romney's longstanding advantage as the candidate voters say is most likely to restore the economy and create jobs; poll finds that overall, voters who are most likely to vote favor Pres Obama over Mitt Romney by 49 percent to 46 percent.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN
byline.contributor: Allison Kopicki, Marina Stefan and Dalia Sussman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama has taken away Mitt Romney’s advantage as the candidate voters say is most likely to restore the economy, according to the latest poll by The New York Times and CBS News.

headline.seo: Obama Erases Romney’s Edge on Economy, Poll Finds
headline.main: Poll Finds Obama Is Erasing Romney’s Edge on Economy
headline.print_headline: Poll Finds Obama Is Erasing Romney’s Edge on Economy
